p: Heat waves (frequency and length) were the focus of particular attention in these climate projections because this information is required for milk loss methods (model M5 and M6 in Table 1) that were firstly introduced in this study. A heat wave is defined as a period when the daily maximum temperature exceeds the 90th percentile of a reference distribution (years between 1980 and 2009) for at least 3 consecutive days [ 18].
